page.title: 19FARMING IN GLENLUCE
page.content: The warm, moist{climate}of the area supports a thriving agriculture. Winters are comparatively mild and the growing season protracted. Besides being in Scotland's premier{dairying county Glenluce is the hub of a district boasting several{different {enterprises,}such as beef, sheep, pig rearing and fattening, barley and potato growing. Dairy cattle are mostly Friesian and Ayrshire, whilst the beef breeds of Galloway, Hereford and Irish Blues are often crossed with more exotic strains such as Charolais, Holstein, Simmental and Romagnola. {Galloway beef is renowned.}Farmers have few labourers permanently working for them now, but employ casual labour at busy times like silage and harvest. Recent {milk quotas}introduced by the European Common Market have curtailed the production of milk.
